Description: Part B is the second segment of a 3-part course on programming languages, focusing on functional programming using ML, Racket, and Ruby. It builds on the foundation laid in Part A, enhancing language mastery and elegant programming. Ideal for those with prior programming experience, completing all three parts offers comprehensive learning and motivation to explore a novel approach to software development.

Course_Name: Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: Nand to Tetris Part II (project-centered course)
Description: In this project-centered course, you'll build a software hierarchy to execute high-level languages on basic computer hardware. You'll create a virtual machine, a Java-like compiler, and an operating system, gaining hands-on experience in computer science concepts. No prerequisites are needed, and all required tools are provided. It's a self-contained course with a 6-week completion timeline, and it's designed to help you apply newfound skills to a real-world project.

The second course in the Machine Learning Specialization explores neural networks and TensorFlow for multi-class classification. You'll also master best practices for real-world machine learning and delve into decision trees, random forests, and boosted trees. Taught by AI luminary Andrew Ng, this beginner-friendly program equips you with the essentials of machine learning and practical skills for real-world AI applications. Based on Andrew's highly-rated course, this 3-course Specialization offers a comprehensive introduction to modern machine learning, empowering you to tackle real-world challenges in AI and machine learning effectively. Ideal for those aspiring to launch an AI or machine learning career.

This course delves into crucial topics for programmers, emphasizing algorithm and data structure knowledge with practical Java implementations. Part I covers fundamental data structures, sorting, and searching algorithms, while Part II explores graph and string processing. The course is entirely free, but it doesn't provide a completion certificate.

This 3-part course, comprising Parts A, B, and C, is an accessible introduction to programming languages, with a strong focus on functional programming. While using ML, Racket, and Ruby as teaching tools, the core aim is to equip learners with the foundational knowledge to excel in programming across languages. It emphasizes effective language construct utilization, elegant program design, and robust, reusable code. Prior programming experience is assumed, and the three-part structure motivates progression. Prepare to explore a fresh and beautiful approach to software development.

The Machine Learning Specialization, led by AI expert Andrew Ng, offers a comprehensive three-course program. It covers unsupervised learning techniques, recommender systems, and deep reinforcement learning. With a beginner-friendly approach, you'll gain a strong foundation in machine learning and practical skills to apply AI in real-world scenarios. Ideal for those aspiring to enter the AI and machine learning field.

This course on TensorFlow 2 provides a comprehensive learning experience in deep learning model development. It covers building, training, and evaluating models using the Sequential API, including practical coding tutorials and assignments. Suitable for beginners and those with TensorFlow 1.x experience, it requires proficiency in Python and basic machine learning and deep learning knowledge.

This course introduces Python programming, covering core concepts like data structures, loops, variables, and functions. It offers practical coding experience with tools and exercises focusing on common data structures, custom functions, and file operations. Compared to other introductory Python courses, it provides a more in-depth exploration of essential programming topics.

This MOOC equips you with foundational programming skills, focusing on writing interactive graphical programs in a real programming language. You'll start by mastering program editing and execution. Then, you'll delve into creating 2D graphics using shapes and coordinates. The course also covers building interactive graphics controlled by mouse input. To apply your skills, you'll solve interactive puzzles in the Sleuth game, designed for this course. JavaScript and the p5.js library are used throughout the course.

Course_Name: Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
Description: This introductory course teaches the fundamentals of computer programming using Python. It's designed for learners with no prerequisites and avoids complex mathematics. With moderate computer experience, anyone can grasp the content. The course covers Chapters 1-5 of the "Python for Everybody" textbook and prepares students for advanced programming courses. It focuses on Python 3.

Expanding on the Python for Everybody course's success, this Specialization delves into core programming concepts, data structures, networked APIs, and databases using Python. The Capstone Project will test your knowledge, as you apply these skills to develop your data retrieval, processing, and visualization applications.

This certificate program, crafted by Meta (Facebook and Instagram creators), equips you for a front-end developer career. You'll master HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, design with Bootstrap, React, and Figma, GitHub for version control, and technical interview preparation. Nine projects build hands-on experience, culminating in a capstone front-end web application.

Course_Name: Build Dynamic User Interfaces (UI) for Websites
Description: Course six in a UX design program, "Responsive Web Design in Adobe XD" teaches you to create responsive websites using Adobe XD. Google's UX experts guide you through the UX design process, from empathy to prototyping. By the end, you'll have a new project for your portfolio and knowledge on job hunting and resume building. Suitable for beginners with basic design understanding.

Course_Name: Web Design for Everybody: Basics of Web Development & Coding Specialization
Description: This Specialization focuses on HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript to create well-structured, interactive, and accessible web content. You'll master these technologies to craft responsive websites that perform flawlessly on various devices. The capstone project is your opportunity to showcase your growth as a web developer, demonstrating accessible web design for diverse users, including those with disabilities. Your professional-quality web portfolio will reflect your skills in creating inclusive web experiences.

Course_Name: HTML, CSS, and Javascript for Web Developers
Description: This course underscores the critical role of web page functionality in user interaction. It emphasizes the need for fast loading, responsive design that adapts to all devices. Starting with HTML and CSS, you'll progress to creating pages that automatically adjust to various screen sizes, ensuring a seamless user experience. The course culminates with a comprehensive introduction to JavaScript, empowering you to develop dynamic web applications with server-side functionality exposed via Ajax.

Course_Name: Responsive Website Development and Design Specialization
Description: This specialization focuses on responsive web design, covering full-stack web development, including HTML/CSS, Javascript, MongoDB, and meteor.js. It guides learners through projects to demonstrate proficiency in layout control, security, and multi-user experiences. The capstone project involves idea generation, peer feedback, and creating a functional web application, showcasing acquired skills.

This course, a part of the Web Design For Everybody specialization, covers Cascading Style Sheets (CSS3) â€“ a fundamental aspect of modern web design. You'll learn to write CSS rules, test code, and adopt sound programming practices. Effective styling can enhance webpages, but mistakes can hinder accessibility. You'll explore POUR accessibility guidelines to ensure inclusivity. By the course's conclusion, you'll be proficient in designing web layouts, incorporating fonts, colors, and more. Access to a computer is essential for completing the assignments.

"Build Wireframes and Low-Fidelity Prototypes" is the third course in a UX design certificate program, equipping you for entry-level roles. You'll create storyboards, wireframes, and low-fidelity prototypes for a mobile app in Figma. Google's UX designers guide you through hands-on activities to simulate real-world design scenarios, enhancing your portfolio. Prior completion of two program courses or proficiency in user research is recommended. Paper and writing tools are essential for certain activities.

This Specialization, featuring a team of diverse instructors, bridges the gap between algorithmic theory and practical implementation. Unlike traditional algorithm courses, this program emphasizes real-world coding challenges, with nearly 100 problems to solve in your language of choice. It's a unique blend of theoretical and applied algorithms, combined with software engineering, to prepare you for job interviews. The specialization includes two hands-on projects, focusing on road networks, social networks, and genome assembly. These projects offer practical insights into solving complex, real-world problems and are a valuable addition to your skill set.

This course is part of Google's Project Management Certificate program and focuses on Agile project management, particularly the Scrum framework. You'll learn Agile's history, philosophy, and values, as well as Scrum's key pillars and team roles. The course covers Product Backlog management, Scrum events, value-driven delivery, and coaching Agile teams. It equips you with the skills needed for entry-level project management roles, even if you have no prior experience.

The Deep Learning Specialization is your gateway to understanding and contributing to cutting-edge AI technology. Develop your expertise in neural networks, including Convolutional and Recurrent Neural Networks, LSTMs, Transformers, and optimization strategies. Apply your knowledge using Python and TensorFlow in real-world scenarios like speech recognition and chatbots. Industry experts offer career guidance, making it the perfect step to advance your AI career. Master deep learning and build practical skills through hands-on projects that cover various applications, from image recognition to natural language processing.

This programming language course offers an introduction to fundamental concepts with a strong focus on functional programming. Using languages like ML, Racket, and Ruby as tools, the course aims to impart a deep understanding of how programming languages work. It goes beyond syntax, teaching you to create elegant, robust, and reusable code. The course is divided into three parts, providing intermediate milestones and a pause for deeper learning. It assumes some prior programming experience and encourages a fresh perspective on software development.

Welcome to the Complete Web Development Bootcamp, a top-rated course with 150,000+ reviews averaging 4.8 stars on Udemy. Led by the App Brewery's head instructor, this 65+ hour program is 2023-ready, covering the latest tools and technologies used by major companies like Apple, Google, and Netflix. You'll learn through engaging video tutorials, hands-on projects, and extensive content on front-end and back-end web development, web design, and even Web3 and blockchain tech. Gain the skills to build a variety of websites and a portfolio of 32+ projects. Enroll now and unlock a world of web development opportunities.

Welcome to the Web Developer Bootcamp's all-new version, tailored for 2023 with over 60 hours of fresh content. It's designed for beginners and covers up-to-date technologies, making it one of the most comprehensive web development courses available. With a variety of engaging teaching methods, it's an exciting and rewarding journey into web development. Enroll today to join the world of coding and development.

Course_Name: Web Development Masterclass - Online Certification Course
Description: This comprehensive web development course takes you from setting up local servers with WAMP and MAMP to deploying with the LAMP stack. It covers essential web technologies, including HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, jQuery, XML, AJAX, PHP, and MySQL. Ideal for beginners and enthusiasts, the course provides both foundational and advanced concepts. Unlock your web development potential with "The Complete Web Developer Course 3.0." Taught by Rob Percival, this comprehensive course features over 25 hours of fresh 2023 content. Gain one year of free hosting and even a free eBook. With support from experts and a vibrant community, this is your path to web development excellence. Course_Name: The Complete Web Developer in 2023: Zero to Mastery
Description: Stay at the forefront of web development with the most up-to-date skills in 2023! This comprehensive course, created by industry expert Andrei, ensures you're job-ready. No outdated technologies here; you'll master in-demand tools used by tech giants like Google, Facebook, and more. Covering everything from HTML to security, you'll be well-equipped to land developer roles and boost your salary. Join over 900,000 developers in a thriving online community. This course is the first installment in a comprehensive nine-part series that delves deep into the intricacies of the internet and web development. It covers fundamental concepts of data packet movement, including TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, SMTP, and more. Students learn the basics of web development and planning, web hosting options, domain management, local testing server configuration, and the setup of live production servers using cloud hosting providers like Linode. Practical demonstrations and hands-on training are included, ensuring students gain a strong foundation in these crucial aspects of web development.

Course_Name: Create a Members Only Blog using PHP, MySQL, & AJAX
Description: This course offers a hands-on approach to web application development using PHP, MySQL, and AJAX. It focuses on creating a dynamic blog with features like member registration and login, session management, contact forms, and email transmission. Key concepts covered include login authentication, database development, AJAX integration, PHPMailer for email transmission, and form development with validation. By the end of the course, students will have gained essential skills for building web applications, from developing dynamic web pages in PHP to deploying projects on production servers.

Course_Name: The Complete 2023 PHP Full Stack Web Developer Bootcamp
Description: Enroll in a 12-course Complete Web Development Bootcamp to master essential skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap, PHP, MySQL, and more. Gain 48+ hours of training, access to premium resources, PHP projects, and a PHP Full Stack Web Developer certification. Perfect for job seekers, freelancers, or skill enhancement, with a 30-day money-back guarantee.

Course_Name: Pre-Programming: Everything you need to know before you code
Description: Learn the technology basics you need to enter the programming world with confidence. This course, taught by Evan Kimbrell, covers fundamental knowledge to help you understand how browsers work, desktop applications, server issues, and more. Gain tech literacy to excel in a rapidly growing industry. Evan Kimbrell, with years of experience, will guide you to bridge the knowledge gap. Prepare for over 2 million high-paying programming jobs coming in the next decade. Master the essentials of technology and join the coding revolution.

Course_Name: The Complete 2020 Fullstack Web Developer Course
Description: Become a full-stack web developer with over 66 hours of video instruction in "The Complete Fullstack Web Developer Course." Course_Name: Ultimate Web Designer & Web Developer Course
Description: Become a full-stack web designer in 2023 with the Ultimate Web Designer & Web Developer Course! Taught by experienced web designer Brad Hussey, this comprehensive course covers everything from web design basics to front-end development skills. Whether you're a beginner or an expert, this trusted Udemy course will equip you for success. Start your journey to becoming a full-stack web designer today!

This comprehensive web development course covers CSS, Bootstrap, and JavaScript, providing essential skills for aspiring web developers. Learn CSS 3 and HTML 5 to create modern, interactive web designs. Explore Bootstrap, understanding its grid system, forms, alerts, and more. Finally, delve into JavaScript, mastering its fundamentals, scripting elements, variables, functions, and error handling. Suitable for beginners, this course is an excellent starting point to build a strong foundation in web development. Start your journey to becoming a proficient web developer today.

Course_Name: Python Mega Course: Learn Python in 60 Days, Build 20 Apps
Description: Become a confident Python programmer in 60 days with "The Python Mega Course." Master Python basics and advance to web development, data analysis, and machine learning. Build 20 practical applications, create an impressive portfolio hosted on GitHub, and prepare for a successful career in Python. Flexible learning with lifetime access. Join thousands of students who have transformed their lives with Python. Start your Python journey today and embrace endless possibilities!

Course_Name: Full stack web development and AI with Python (Django)
Description: This course teaches you how to become a full stack web developer, Django and AI expert. You will learn how to create websites and AI models using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, Django, TensorFlow, etc. You will also gain valuable skills and a portfolio of projects. The course is suitable for beginners and experienced developers. It offers a 30-day money-back guarantee. The instructor is a Udemy featured instructor.

Course_Name: Python Django 4 Masterclass | Build a Real World Project
Description: This course teaches you how to become a full stack web developer using Python and Django. You will learn how to create web applications, use databases, implement authentication, deploy apps, and make APIs. The course is taught by Faisal Memon, a Google Launchpad Accelerator alumni with 12 years of experience. The course is suitable for beginners and experienced developers. It offers a 30-day money-back guarantee.

Course_Name: Introduction to Web Design and Development
Description: Explore web design and development with instructor Jen Kramer. This course introduces you to the fundamental concepts of web creation. Learn about clients, servers, and browsers, master website planning, and understand user experience and interface. Discover HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, or explore non-coding tools if coding isn't your preference. Start your journey into the world of web design and development with this comprehensive introduction.

HTML, the foundation of web development, is crucial for effective communication with both humans and machines. Dive into the world of HTML in this course led by instructor Jen Simmons. Discover the key elements of crafting meaningful HTML content, with a strong emphasis on semantic markup. Learn to tag content for its true purpose, not just for appearance. This approach ensures accessibility and clear categorization for screen readers and search engines, making your content universally understandable and valuable.

In this hands-on CSS course with instructor Christina Truong, you'll master the fundamentals of Cascading Style Sheets. Learn how to customize webpage appearance, from adding colors and design elements to understanding selectors and the box model. Explore text styling, layout management with Flexbox and Grid, and the use of float and position properties. Put your knowledge to the test with practical projects, empowering you to enhance web design with confidence.

JavaScript has transformed from an optional element to an essential part of web development. This course, led by instructor Morten Rand-Hendriksen, guides you through JavaScript fundamentals, from variables to DOM scripting. It includes interactive Code Challenges via CoderPad for hands-on practice, enabling you to master dynamic web interfaces and advanced interactions.

Effective search skills are often a key part of programming talent. In this course, instructor Morten Rand-Hendriksen highlights several search techniques that you, as a web developer, need to know. Morten begins by explaining where to find reliable information. He goes over several possibilities, including the original source, Platformresources, status reference sites, and community resources. Next, Morten shows you how to master searches with search techniques for Google, other search engines, internal site searches, and GitHub. He concludes with a discussion of the developers behind every line of code and how you can enrich your searches for information through participating in and contributing to online communities.

To be an effective web programmer, you have to understand what happens when you enter a URL or click on a link. Under every webpage lies the markupâ€”JavaScript, HTML, and CSSâ€”and the hierarchy that controls displayâ€”the Document Object Model (DOM). Then there is the server that hosts the files, the browser that renders them, the metadata, and the mobile experience to consider. Explore what happens below the surface, and learn how to write better code. This course provides a deep dive into the world wide web, and the underlying structures you need to understand to build robust applications and websites that are efficient and easy to maintain. Learn how HTML documents provide the foundation for CSS and JavaScript, and see how to layer presentation and interactions on top. Learn how different code editors and browsers interact with web content, enabling editing, programming, and display. Discover why accessibility is so important to keeping the web open and available to all users, and what workflow works best for web programming. Instructor Morten Rand-Hendriksen keeps the lessons fun and fast-paced, so it's easy for almost anyoneâ€”web programmers, web designers, and even web publishersâ€”to follow along.

Course_Name: Simplifying Web Development with Accessibility Best Practices
Description: Too often in the world of web development, accessibility is given a low level of priority in the development stage of a site and is often relegated to experts for later implementation. But why spend the time and money hiring an outside consultant when you can set up a website for proper accessibility at the build stage? In this course, Morten Rand-Hendriksen shows the benefits of taking this approach, and how simple it is to do so. As Morten explains, all thatâ€™s needed is a basic understanding of why these elements are so important, how they work, and how good coding practices and modern web standards can get you there with little extra work. He tackles accessibility from all sides, starting with the origins of some of the most common accessibility issues and how to address them, then covers key topics like accessible design, hiding and showing visual content, handling graphics and media, and the semantic elements that can help make your designs more accessible.

Among all other JavaScript libraries, React.js stands out. It relies on reusable components, not templates, for UI development, allowing developers to render views where data changes over time. React applications are more scalable and more maintainable, making developers more efficient and users more satisfied. In this course, Eve Porcello introduces the basics of the React library using the most modern syntax and best practices for creating React components. Along the way, learn how to set up Chrome tools for React; create new components; work with the built-in Hooks in React; use the Create React App to run tests, and more. By the end of the course, you'll be armed with the essentials of React.js and better prepared to build your own browser-based projects.

React is a JavaScript library with reusable components and a unique data rendering approach. Web interfaces that you create with React are flexible, fast, and lightweight. In this course, instructor Ray Villalobos reviews component architecture in React and covers key skills that you need to be able to build interfaces. Ray steps through how to install React and get started with components, debugging, and variables. He explains how you can pass data to a component, use the useState hook and conditional classes, and toggle items by passing the state to a sub-component and using values to hide or show sub-components. Ray describes how you can delete records, search with a filtered array, set up a sort, and more. He shows how you can finish up your application by creating the code for adding appointments.

Over the past few years, new APIs and features have been proliferating through modern web browsers. These APIs can help you build amazing web apps that perform better, work offline, delight the user, and provide better user experiences overall. In this course, learn how to use standard JavaScript and a selection of modern browser APIs to improve data retrieval and storage, get better app performance, and build web pages that seamlessly integrate into your user's everyday life. Instructor Joe Marini details how to leverage modern storage capabilities in browsers, take advantage of native device user experiences, get better performance from animations and page loading, and much more.

Course_Name: Getting Started as a Full-Stack Web Developer
Description: Have you ever said, â€œI want to get into web development, but I don't know where to startâ€? If youâ€™re looking for practical ways to begin, then this introductory course is for you. Instructor Tom Geller gets you started on the multi-skill path to becoming a full-stack web developer. Tom introduces the tools youâ€™ll use, then walks you through some simple tasks you can do right away. He shows you how to get online with a webhost, then tackles technologies that you can use to show information, such as HTML and CSS. Tom goes over types of programming languages, website security, tools that let you connect to databases and other sites, and more. He explains ways you can build on the work of others, then concludes with practical advice on developing your skills.

Node.js is a powerful tool for controlling servers, building web applications, and creating event-driven programs. And it takes JavaScriptâ€”a language familiar to all web developersâ€”out of the browser. With Node.js, you can build applications that run on your laptop or even the cloud. In this course, learn the essentials of Node.js and start creating your own JavaScript applications. Instructor Eve Porcello covers all of the basics, showing how to install Node.js and work with the Node.js core, which includes standard input, standard output, the module system, the file system, and how to write and run JavaScript on the server. Upon wrapping up this course, youâ€™ll be equipped with fundamental Node.js concepts and techniques that you can put to use in your next project.

GeeksforGeeks presents for the first time ever: Offline Classroom Program on Full Stack Development. You will learn to build dynamic, scalable web applications using MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js - in offline classes and in an interactive manner. So join the classes today to become a MERN Stack Developer!

Course_Name: Full Stack Developer Bootcamp - Master Frontend to Backend
Description: Being a Full Stack Developer requires one to be familiar with a wide range of web technologies, both front-end as well as back-end. They are responsible for designing, developing, and managing the full stack of an application or website. With this Full Stack Bootcamp, you will learn all the essential skills needed to become a successful web developer.The course aims to help you master all the basic and advanced level skills in the various tools and technologies involved in the field of Web Development. We will cover HTML, CSS, JavaScript and React JS for our frontend part, whereas we will complete our Backend part with Node JS and Mongo DB. You will also be getting hands on experience on project building which will greatly help boost your understanding of concepts.

This program is designed to take you on a transformative journey from mastering Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA) to becoming a proficient developer. Whether you aspire to become a full-stack developer or specialize in a specific technology stack, this program provides the essential building blocks for your coding journey starting right from basic programming to building applications.

Data science is driving a world-wide revolution that touches everything from business automation to social interaction. Itâ€™s also one of the fastest growing, most rewarding careers, employing analysts and engineers around the globe. This course provides an accessible, nontechnical overview of the field, covering the vocabulary, skills, jobs, tools, and techniques of data science. Instructor Barton Poulson defines the relationships to other data-saturated fields such as machine learning and artificial intelligence. He reviews the primary practices: gathering and analyzing data, formulating rules for classification and decision-making, and drawing actionable insights. He also discusses ethics and accountability and provides direction to learn more. By the end, youâ€™ll see how data science can help you make better decisions, gain deeper insights, and make your work more effective and efficient.

The world of data science is reshaping every business, regardless of industry, location, or role. And thereâ€™s never been a better time to get up to speed and learn the basics of this booming field. In this course, designed specifically for beginners, explore the world of data science, its opportunities and innovations, and the fundamental skills required for success.

Course_Name: Python for Data Science Essential Training Part 1
Description: Python for Data Science Essential Training is one of the most popular data science courses at LinkedIn Learning. It has now been updated and expanded to two partsâ€”for even more hands-on experience with Python. In this course, instructor Lillian Pierson takes you step by step through a practical data science project: a web scraper that downloads and analyzes data from the web. Along the way, she introduces techniques to clean, reformat, transform, and describe raw data; generate visualizations; remove outliers; perform simple data analysis; and generate interactive graphs using the Plotly library. You should walk away from this training with basic coding experience that you can take to your organization and quickly apply to your own custom data science projects.

Course_Name: Ultimate AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate SAA-C03
Description: FULLY UPDATED FOR SAA-C03: Pass the AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate Certification Full Practice Exam with Explanations included! All 800+ slides available as downloadable PDF Perform Real-World Solution Architecture on AWS Learn the AWS Fundamentals (EC2, ELB, ASG, RDS, ElastiCache, S3) Learn the Serverless Fundamentals (Lambda, DynamoDB, Cognito, API Gateway) Analyze 10+ Solution Architectures (traditional & serverless) Understand the Well Architected Framework, Disaster Recovery Master all the differences of Databases on AWS Secure your entire AWS Cloud using KMS, IAM Policies & SSM
